node.title: Judge John Hodgman on the Uncapped Water Bottle
node.description: A “clumsy fellow” demands his partner be more conscientious with her hydration.
node.content: ["Sasha writes: My partner, Emily, has a tall, narrow water bottle that she insists on keeping uncapped. She also leaves it in random places around the kitchen. I\u2019m a somewhat clumsy fellow and am always knocking it over, spilling water that I then have to clean up! Please order Emily to put the cap back on her bottle. The cap has a spout to be used for drinking its contents!", "I think I know the precise style of water bottle you are talking about, and I hate those tippy jerks. I will order her to be more conscientious in her capping. But I refuse to recommend she drink sippy-cup-style. Buying elastic waistband pants for my late-pandemic body is as far as I want anyone to regress into infanthood. Also: Being a \u201cclumsy fellow\u201d isn\u2019t your job, you know. As we would tell our own heedless kids when they knocked junk off tables: Yes, accidents happen \u2014 but have fewer of them."]
